page.title: 15SKELMORLIE AND THE CLYDE
page.content: The sea plays an important part of life in Skelmorlie. The Clyde is a waterway for traffic. From Wemyss Bay pier there is an hourly ferry service to Rothesay. Up and down the Clyde we see both British and American nuclear submar- ines. Oil tankers, container ships and other cargo ships regularly pass by. There is a "measured mile" at Skelmorlie and naval ships built at Greenock or Port Glasgow have trials off shore. There are small fishing boats in season. Then there are the speedboats,water- skiers,pleasure craft and numerous yachts and dinghies.The "tall ships" are also often seen, looking majestic in full sail.
